paper_abstract: As an emerging technique, brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) bring us a new communication interface which can translate brain activities into control signals of devices like computers, robots etc. In this study, we introduce an independent component analysis (ICA) based semi-supervised learning algorithm for BCI systems. In this algorithm, we separate the raw electroencephalographic (EEC) signals into several independent components using ICA; then choose a best independent component for feature extraction and classification. To demonstrate the validity of our algorithm, we apply it to an data set from an EEC-based cursor control experiment implemented in Wadsworth Center. The data analysis results show that both ICA preprocessing and semi-supervised learning can improve prediction accuracy significantly.
paper_title: ICA based semi-supervised learning algorithm for BCI systems
